articles.title: Kim Jong Il Inspects Vegetable Science Institute and Floriculture Institute
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Inspects Vegetable Science Institute and Floriculture Institute
Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave field guidance to the modern Pyongyang Vegetable Science Institute and Pyongyang Floriculture Institute.
					 The first leg of his guidance was the Pyongyang Vegetable Science Institute.
					
					The institute having a total floor space of 500,000 square meters is located on the outskirts of Pyongyang. It is a modern and comprehensive vegetable science center which conducts researches and produces vegetables simultaneously as it has many greenhouses with facilities for the study of the latest science and production and a large area of research fields.
					
					 The watering, application of fertilizers, temperature and humidity control and all other processes at the institute are computerized.
					
					 Researchers of the institute cultivated at least vegetables of more than 50 species of over 20 plants such as cucumber No. 19 and tomato No. 15 growing in hothouses. They also developed the new technology of cultivating cabbage in the vinyl sheet-roofed hothouse without a heating system in winter and 19 other new technologies, more than doubling the productivity as compared with that in the past.
					
					 He looked round the water culture greenhouse and solar-heated vinyl sheet-roofed hothouse and other places for hours to learn in detail about scientific researches and production.
					
					 He looked with keen attention at the round eggplants and semi-round ones, spring radish, sweet pepper, aromatic parsley, etc. developed and produced by the scientists and researchers of the institute. 
					
					 It is a great success that the institute is boosting the production of vegetables after laying a solid scientific and technological foundation for positively contributing to the improvement of the people's diet and the promotion of their health, he said, highly appreciating the spirit of their devoted service to the people.
					
					 Noting that the institute has an important role to play for increasing the nation's vegetable production and improving the people's standard of living, he advanced important tasks to be fulfilled by the institute.
					
					  The next leg of his guidance was the Pyongyang Floricultural Institute.
					
					 It is a modern floricultural institute whose site was chosen by him and to which he sent all necessary equipment for researches. It is the ultramodern institute as all the processes there including temperature and humidity control are computerized. 
					
					 After being briefed on the institute before its huge map showing its panoramic view, he went round various places of the institute including a bio-engineering research room to learn in detail about its construction and researches there.
					
					 He met scientists and technicians including People's Scientist Prof. and Dr. Ri Ung Ho, who have achieved a lot of successes in researches, working in this field for years and highly estimated their merits.
					
					 He underscored the need to continue channeling great efforts into the floricultural cultivation in order to make flowers of all species bloom in the country good to live in, the golden tapestry of three thousand-ri , advancing important tasks to be fulfilled by the institute. 
					
					 He was accompanied by Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, Hong Sok Hyong, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK, Kim Kyong Hui, member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK, Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and Thae Jong Su, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK.

articles.title: DPRK RC Society Urges S. Korea to Send Back Detained Inhabitants
articles.content:
DPRK RC Society Urges S. Korea to Send Back Detained Inhabitants
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- An event took place in Pyongyang on Tuesday to mark the 92nd anniversary of the March First Popular Uprising under the sponsorship of the Council for the Reunification of Tangun's Nation.
					 It was attended by members of the council and people from all walks of life in Pyongyang.
					
					 Disclosed and denounced at the event were crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists who brought unspeakable misfortune and sufferings to the Korean people.
					
					 A joint resolution of the north and the south was made public there on the occasion of the anniversary.
					
					 The resolution called on the organizations of the national movement in the north and the south to pool their efforts and wage a movement for national reunification by carrying forward the spirit of sovereignty and independence of the participants in the March First Popular Uprising and thus conduct a dynamic mass movement for foiling the Japanese reactionaries' moves to stage a comeback to Korea and forcing them to make an apology and reparation for their past crimes.
					
					 Declaring that the Koreans will resolutely oppose all sorts of treacherous and anti- reunification acts of infringing upon the interests of the Koreans in collusion with outside forces, the resolution called on them to go united as one under the banner of "By our nation itself!" to achieve the great unity of the nation and vigorously advance along the road of independent reunification

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Congratulates New PM of Jordan
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Congratulates New PM of Jordan
Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Choe Yong Rim on Tuesday sent a congratulatory message to Marouf Al-bakhit on his appointment as Prime Minister of Jordan.
					 The message wished him success in his responsible work for stability and prosperity of the country. 
					
					 On Feb. 28 Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a congratulatory message to Nasser Judeh on his reappointment as foreign minister of Jordan.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop Meets German Guests
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop Meets German Guests
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, met and conversed with Jurgen Klimke, member of the Federal Parliament from the Christian Democratic Union of Germany, and his party at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.

articles.title: Sojourn of German Guests in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Sojourn of German Guests in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- Jurgen Klimke, member of the Federal Parliament from the Christian Democratic Union of Germany, and his party visited Mangyongdae.
					 Being briefed on the great revolutionary history of President Kim Il Sung and his patriotic and revolutionary Mangyongdae family, they looked round the historic relics at his native home in Mangyongdae.
					
					 They also visited the E-library and the Indoor Swimming Pool of Kim Il Sung University, the Tower of the Juche Idea, the Party Founding Memorial Tower, the U.S. armed spy ship "Pueblo", etc. and enjoyed a performance given by the State Symphony Orchestra.

articles.title: Friendship Gathering with Cuban Embassy Officials Held
articles.content:
Friendship Gathering with Cuban Embassy Officials Held
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Foreign Ministry arranged a friendly meeting with staff members of the Cuban embassy here at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club on Thursday.
					 It was to mark the 25th anniversary of the visit to the DPRK by Fidel Castro Ruz, first secretary of the C.C., Communist Party of Cuba.  
					
					 Present at the meeting on invitation were Ambassador Jose Manuel Galego Montano and staff members of the Cuban embassy. 
					
					 Vice-Minister Kim Hyong Jun and other officials of the DPRK Foreign Ministry were on hand. 
					
					 The participants talked about the need to boost the DPRK-Cuba relations and had sports amusement games.

articles.title: Meeting of Korean Committee for Solidarity with Cuba Held
articles.content:
Meeting of Korean Committee for Solidarity with Cuba Held
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- An annual meeting of the Korean Committee for Solidarity with Cuba took place at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club on Thursday.
					 Present there were Kim Yong Jin, chairman of the Education Commission and chairman of the Committee, Mun Jae Chol, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and members of the Committee. 
					
					 Ambassador Jose Manuel Galego Montano and staff members of the Cuban embassy here were on hand. 
					
					 The meeting reviewed the work done by the Committee last year for friendship and solidarity with the Cuban people advancing along the banner of socialism while protecting the country's sovereignty and revolutionary gains under the leadership of the Communist Party of Cuba. And it discussed the action program of the Committee for this year.

articles.title: Bulgaria's National Day Observed in DPRK
articles.content:
Bulgaria's National Day Observed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- A film show was held at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club on Thursday on the occasion of the national day of the Republic of Bulgaria. It was arranged by the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and the DPRK-Bulgaria Friendship Association.
					 Present there on invitation were Vihren Nikolov, Bulgarian charge d' affaires a.i. here, and his embassy officials.
					
					 Present there were members of the Association and working people in the city of Pyongyang.
					
					 The participants watched a Bulgarian documentary film.

articles.title: Finnish Party Delegation Gives Impressions of DPRK
articles.content:
Finnish Party Delegation Gives Impressions of DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Finnish Communists' League on Feb. 23 gave its impressions of the DPRK to the newspaper Kansan Eeni. It visited the DPRK from Feb. 12 to 19.
					 In an article contributed to the paper it said:
					
					 During its visit to the DPRK the delegation of the Finnish Communists' League keenly realized that the Korean people remain loyal to General Secretary Kim Jong Il with deep respect and reverence for him and that they are full of confidence and hope to build a thriving socialist nation without fail under his wise leadership.
					
					 It also came to know that the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) has been making big efforts for the economic development and prosperity of the country and well-being of its people.
					
					 Our delegation won firm convince during its stay in the DPRK that the Korean revolution reached its fresh heyday with the WPK Conference held last year as an occasion and the revolutionary cause of Kim Jong Il would be creditably carried forward to completion.
					
					 It could witness the fact that new miracles and innovations are wrought in all sectors of socialist construction and the drive to put production equipment on a modern and CNC basis is rapidly progressing in the DPRK.
					
					 Under the wise Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il the WPK and the Korean people will always win victory only in socialist construction, the article stressed.

articles.title: National Meeting of Active Agricultural Workers Held
articles.content:
National Meeting of Active Agricultural Workers Held
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- A national meeting of active members of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea in the Songun era was held here on Thursday. 
					 Present there were Premier Choe Yong Rim, Secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea Choe Ryong Hae, Minister of Agriculture Ri Kyong Sik and officials concerned. 
					
					 The meeting reviewed the successes and experience gained in the work of the union over the past years and discussed the tasks and ways for its members and other agricultural workers to fulfill their responsibility and duty in implementing the WPK's policy of agricultural revolution. 
					
					 Ri Myong Gil, chairman of the Union Central Committee, made a report which was followed by speeches. 
					
					The reporter and speakers noted that a new history of large-scale land realignment and building of gravity-fed waterways was made under the energetic guidance of General Secretary Kim Jong Il. They also referred to the fact that a solid foundation for the nation's agricultural development was laid such as completion of Juche-oriented fertilizer production system and Taegyedo tideland reclamation.
					
					 They stressed the need for the union organizations to fulfill their mission and duty as an education body in the drive to attain the goal of grain production this year. 
					
					 They said that the exemplary farms should set their goals higher for competition and all other farms should work hard to follow them. 
					
					 An appeal to the union members and other agricultural workers across the country was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Anniversary of 3.1 Popular Uprising Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of 3.1 Popular Uprising Observed
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- An event took place in Pyongyang on Tuesday to mark the 92nd anniversary of the March First Popular Uprising under the sponsorship of the Council for the Reunification of Tangun's Nation.
					 It was attended by members of the council and people from all walks of life in Pyongyang.
					
					 Disclosed and denounced at the event were crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists who brought unspeakable misfortune and sufferings to the Korean people.
					
					 A joint resolution of the north and the south was made public there on the occasion of the anniversary.
					
					 The resolution called on the organizations of the national movement in the north and the south to pool their efforts and wage a movement for national reunification by carrying forward the spirit of sovereignty and independence of the participants in the March First Popular Uprising and thus conduct a dynamic mass movement for foiling the Japanese reactionaries' moves to stage a comeback to Korea and forcing them to make an apology and reparation for their past crimes.

articles.title: Russian Orchestra Gives Its Premiere in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Russian Orchestra Gives Its Premiere in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- The visiting Orchestra of the 21st Century of Russia gave its premiere at the East Pyongyang Grand Theatre on Thursday.
					 The performance was conducted by people's artistes and merited artistes and other noted conductors, instrumentalists and singers.
					
					  Its numbers included "March of Peace and Love," "I Will Go with You" and Korean song "Let's Drink a Toast".
					
					 The performers truthfully represented the Russian people's deep love of the motherland, traditional customs and optimistic life.  
					
					 The audience included An Tong Chun, minister of Culture, officials concerned, creators and artistes of the Mansudae Art Troupe and other national art organizations and teachers and students in the field of art education.
					
					 Valery E. Sukhinin, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, and his embassy officials were among the audience.

articles.title: Multimedia Service for Study of Three Commanders' Activities
articles.content:
Multimedia Service for Study of Three Commanders' Activities  
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- The e-library of Kim Il Sung University offers access to multimedia about activities of the three commanders of Mt. Paektu -- President Kim Il Sung, General Secretary Kim Jong Il and anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					 It contains an introduction, their activities in different periods and sectors, chronicles of the Songun (military-first) revolution, reminiscences, legends and references. 
					
					 Jang Tong Chol, a section chief of the e-library, told KCNA that the multimedia is of help to the university teachers and students in studying their activities.

articles.title: Online Information Service Available
articles.content:
Online Information Service Available
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- The Central Information Agency for Science and Technology offers a nationwide online information service on latest scientific and technological achievements.
					 The agency provides information about latest patent technologies and economic and trade activities, as well as software.
					
					 The all-day-long service is offered through its homepage "Kwangmyong".
					
					 The agency also organizes IT clinics every month.
					
					 It publishes "Foreign Scientific and Technological Information", "Technical Innovation", "Science World" and other periodicals.

articles.title: Large Winch Installed in Unryul Mine
articles.content:
Large Winch Installed in Unryul Mine
						
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- A large winch for removing overburden was installed in the Unryul Mine recently.
					 The skip carries several million tons of earth a year, operated by computer.
					
					 The winch makes it possible for the mine to remove overburden with less trucks, manpower and fuel and boost iron ore production.
					
					 The Unryul Mine is one of the country's leading iron ore producers.

articles.title: Scientific Farming Encouraged
articles.content:
Scientific Farming Encouraged
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- Much effort has been made in the DPRK to put farming on a scientific basis.
					 The Ministry of Agriculture has regularly provided farms throughout the country with videos showing agricultural scientific and technological achievements.
					
					 It has also informed agricultural guidance organs in each province, city and county of estimated crop growth, weather forecast and necessary technological measures, so that the farms can cultivate all crops in a scientific way suitable to their soil and climate conditions.
					
					 Meanwhile, all the agricultural guidance organs and co-op farms have introduced advanced farming methods and technology in season under their long-term plans.
					
					 Mud snails have been used to weed rice fields in the Mangyongdae Vegetable Farm in Pyongyang and many farms in Yomju County of North Phyongan Province, Pongchon County of South Hwanghae Province, Hwangju County of North Hwanghae Province and other areas.
					
					 The number of agricultural engineers and associate engineers has steadily increased in the country through the study-while-working system.
					
					 Many effective farm machines have been invented by them.

articles.title: Nature-driven Irrigation System Proves Effective
articles.content:
Nature-driven Irrigation System Proves Effective 
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- The gravity-fed irrigation system has yielded a great result in the DPRK.
					 The first of its kind is the Kaechon-Lake Thaesong waterway built in October Juche 91 (2002).
					
					 The channel fully waters the arable land in at least ten cities, counties and districts of South Phyongan Province, Pyongyang and Nampho.
					
					 Later, the Paekma-Cholsan waterway and Miru plain waterway appeared to supply irrigation water to several counties of North Phyongan and North Hwanghae Provinces without consumption of electricity.
					
					 A nature-driven irrigation system was also set up in a reclaimed tideland in Chongdan County, South Hwanghae Province.
					
					 Many other areas also benefit from the irrigation system, which has been expanded throughout the country.

articles.title: New Illumination Photometry Invented
articles.content:
New Illumination Photometry Invented 
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang University of Printing invented a new illumination photometry.
					 The method makes it possible to measure light distribution with a digital camera and raise the light effect, not using complex and expensive facilities.
					
					 When the value of illumination from the brightest angle is measured, that from other angles and a change in light intensity come out accurately. And the light distribution from one or more illuminators is also measured quickly without any light sensors.
					
					 The method has already been applied to the Tower of the Juche Idea, People's Palace of Culture and other edifices for light decoration.

articles.title: Local Soccer Tournaments to Be Held
articles.content:
Local Soccer Tournaments to Be Held 
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- Several soccer tournaments will be held this year in the DPRK.
					 The first round of the premier league for 2011 already started at Kim Il Sung Stadium in Pyongyang on February 20. 
					
					 The following rounds will be held on the sidelines of sports contests for Mangyongdae Prize and Pochonbo Torch Prize and national championship. 
					
					 The premier league involves the April 25, Mangyongbong, Sobaeksu, Rimyongsu, Amnokgang, Pyongyang, Kigwancha, Ministry of Light Industry, Ryongnamsan and Ponghwasan teams.
					
					 The Mangyongdae Prize and Pochonbo Torch Prize contests will also include soccer matches of teams outside the premier league, as well as Futsal. 
					
					 A national soccer tournament of provincial teams will take place in May and June and a national youth championship in September and October.
					
					 Technical renovation contests, regional soccer matches and tournament of juvenile sports schools are also expected this year.

articles.title: New Novel Brought Out
articles.content:
New Novel Brought Out
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- A new novel, "Prospering Land", was published in the DPRK.
					 The novel, a part of the serial "Immortal Guidance", was written by Pak Thae Su, with the background of the late 1990s when the country was undergoing ordeals.
					
					It is based on the fact that Geneal Secretary Kim Jong Il initiated land rezoning in Kangwon Province and successfully guided the project.
					
					 In the novel the leader unfolds an ambitious plan to adjust all the arable land of the country as befitting the features of the socialist country and makes the project start in Kangwon Province with many plots.
					
					 Under his leadership, the huge project for improving the layout of fields is completed successfully.
					
					 During the project, people come to cherish ardent love for their land.

articles.title: New Methods for Improving Diet
articles.content:
New Methods for Improving Diet
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- Scientists of the Food Research Institute under the DPRK State Academy of Sciences have made achievements in the researches for improving diet.
					 They invented a new production method of yontubu (soft bean curd) good for health.
					
					 They developed a yontubu coagulant in a microbiological way.
					
					 They also made powdered lactic bacteria for kimchi and completed a new kimchi preparing method.
					
					 Besides, they succeeded in making tasty and nutritive "cheese" with bean porridge and extracting natural food colors from plant roots.

articles.title: Medical Properties of Mt. Paektu Blueberry
articles.content:
Medical Properties of Mt. Paektu Blueberry
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- Blueberry growing in the Mt. Paektu area in the DPRK has ingredients good for health.
					 Containing protein, fat, carbohydrate and vitamins, it is efficacious for cough, hemostasis, hypertension and arteriosclerosis. It is also good for children after suffering the measles and women after giving birth to babies.
					
					 The antibiotic fruit is used for the treatment of enteric diseases, tardive dyskinesia and poisoning.

articles.title: Scenic Spots Undergo Changes
articles.content:
Scenic Spots Undergo Changes
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- Sinphyong Kumgang, a scenic spot in North Hwanghae Province of Korea, is being turned into a picturesque site in the era of Songun.
					 In this area there are many showplaces such as cliffs, peculiar rocks and waterfalls along the Ahobiryong mountainous range.
					
					 The province is building sightseeing paths, bridges, revetment, pavilions and many other service facilities while preserving the beauty spots to their original state.
					
					 Construction of various bridges in 14 spots expanding over 1,000 m and sightseeing roads is nearing completion. Building of sightseeing roads in Nounpho and Kumganggol and structures in several spots has already been completed.
					
					 Meanwhile, the construction of a power station, dwelling houses, a fish pond, soft drinks, clinic, nursery and kindergarten is making headway at fast tempo.

articles.title: KCNA Blasts War Maniac's Inspection of Forefront
articles.content:
KCNA Blasts War Maniac's Inspection of Forefront
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Kwan Jin, minister of Defense of south Korea, Tuesday inspected a forefront unit in the western region.
					 During the inspection he instructed the unit to "imagine the types of provocations by the north" and "preempt actions on the spot when conducting an operation before making a report."
					
					 This is a paroxysm of a war maniac to ignite a war at any cost by escalating the tension on the Korean Peninsula and a very dangerous act of stirring up the confrontation with fellow countrymen.
					
					 Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military maneuvers kicked off by the U.S. and the south Korean puppet clique with huge armed forces involved have created such extremely dangerous situation in the peninsula that a war may break out anytime.
					
					 The forefront is known to the world as a region fraught with the biggest danger of a war. The south Korean military boss appeared there to invest the war maniacs of the unit with the full right to fire at the DPRK's side. This is a serious development which should never be overlooked.
					
					 This is obviously an open military threat to the DPRK and a very provocative act of pushing the situation to the brink of war.
					
					 It is the preoccupation of Kim Kwan Jin to mount a preemptive attack on the north as he is a war maniac without an equal.
					
					 Hence, as soon as he took the office of the defence minister he issued an order to "exercise the right of self-defense with the conception of taking actions before making a report" and blustered that his army would make air raids on the areas of the DPRK side at a meeting of major commanding officers of the armed forces. And he gave all the units including those on the forefront the right to preempt firing. 
					
					 His reckless remarks reflected the above-said scenario in his mind. This is a more dangerous development as they were let loose at a time when the war maneuvers are in their height.
					
					 It is not hard to guess that gunshots fired by war maniacs at the instigation of Kim may trigger off a war on the peninsula. 
					
					 His scenario for preemptive attack was prompted by the ambition of the authorities for "achieving unification through absorption."
					
					 A proof of this is that he raved "he would wrest the military initiative from the north," "the north should be punished till it completely surrenders" and "the leadership of the north and its military are the principal enemy."
					
					 This goes to prove that he is the vicious enemy of the nation, top-class war maniac and wicked traitor.
					
					 Kim would be well advised to bear in mind that he will not escape a stern judgment by history and the nation if he persistently pursues the moves for a war of aggression against the DPRK like a puppy knowing no fear of a tiger.

articles.title: KCNA Warns US-S. Korea of Serious Consequences of Their Saber-rattling
articles.content:
KCNA Warns US-S. Korea of Serious Consequences of Their Saber-rattling 
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- The situation prevailing on the Korean Peninsula is reminiscent of the eve of war due to Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises kicked off by the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces.
					 The on-going saber-rattling is arousing deep concern at home and abroad as it is the maneuver for a nuclear war with their huge offensive means involved. It was kicked off under the U.S. scenario for a war of aggression against the DPRK to swallow up the whole of the Korean Peninsula by force of arms in order to put pressure on the East of the Asian continent.
					
					 It is obviously actual maneuvers for a nuclear war to invade the DPRK in their offensive nature and scale.
					
					 These maneuvers put main emphasis on drills for "eliminating and acquiring WMDs through surprise preemptive strike at the DPRK and the operation to cope with the "contingency" and they are larger in scale. 
					
					 Participating in these exercises are hundreds of personnel of the 20th Support Command present in the U.S., a unit tasked to rapidly cope with, detect and eliminate WMDs, etc.  And naval operation groups including U.S. aircraft carrier and strike flying corps including strategic bombers are getting frantic with maneuvers in the seas and sky.
					
					 The south Korean puppet Defense Ministry blustered that the large-scale U.S. reinforcements are involved in the military exercises as they are needed for occupying the north. This fully reveals their aggressive nature.
					
					 Nevertheless, the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces are describing the saber-rattling as an annual and usual one for defense. This is shameless rhetoric to cover up the true nature of their maneuvers for a war of aggression against the DPRK.
					
					 Those who threw a stumbling block in the way of achieving peace and security on the Korean Peninsula and the region by kicking off the dangerous war maneuvers will have to pay a very high price for them.
					
					 Those who like to play with fire are bound to perish therein.

articles.title: KCNA Terms Japan's Actions against Chongryon Politically Terrorism
articles.content:
KCNA Terms Japan's Actions against Chongryon Politically Terrorism
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- The Resolution and Collection Corporation of Japan committed an outrageous action by provisionally seizing facilities of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) on Feb. 21.
					 On Feb. 18 the Tokyo District Court made a decision on approving the application of the above-said corporation for the provisional seizure of land and buildings of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon.
					
					 The court judged that some 62. 7 billion yen out of the total bond which the corporation bought from the former Tokyo Credit Association of the Korean Bank in June 2007 was a loan for Chongryon and ruled that it should reimburse the total amount. 
					
					 This was a vicious political plot of the Japanese reactionaries to destroy Chongryon through the seizure of its facilities. 
					
					 By origin, the issue of false bond is an economic issue. So the settlement of it through reconciliation has been recognized as the most common and reasonable solution. Hence, the Tokyo High Court recommended the above-said corporation to solve the issue of Chongryon-related facilities including the Hall of its Central Standing Committee through reconciliation. This notwithstanding, the Japanese authorities instructed the corporation to unilaterally scrap the reconciliation proposal. This is a politically motivated grave suppression disregarding the commonly accepted practice concerning the bond issue and an outrageous national discrimination. Provisional seizure is a measure taken by a creditor to preserve the property of a debtor until the court's ruling is confirmed.
					
					  The Japanese authorities kicked up much fuss after raising this issue again a few months before the High Court's decision though the action taken to provisionally seize the above-said facilities in June, 2007 was an unjust attitude. This brought to light their sinister political intention to grab Chongryon-related facilities at any cost.  
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries persistently conducted an anti-Chongryon campaign, regarding its activities as a thorn in their flesh in the past, too.
					
					 What should not be overlooked is that in 2006, 24 cities of Japan announced that they would repeal or reduce the measures to exempt the taxes for Chongryon-related facilities against the backdrop of the whirlwind of anti-DPRK and anti-Chongryon sanctions and the Tokyo District Court ruled that the land and buildings of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon should be sold by auction.
					
					 These facts go to prove that the Japanese reactionaries' campaigns to destroy Chongryon including their moves to grab its facilities have never ceased as they are steeped in bitterness towards Chongryon and Koreans in Japan to the marrow of their bones. This awful terrorism has been ceaselessly perpetrated in various parts of Japan. 
					
					 Chongryon is a legitimate organization of overseas citizens of the DPRK formed to protect the democratic national rights of the Koreans in Japan, the directive victims of the forcible drafting of Koreans committed by the Japanese imperialists in the past, and their descendants. The issue of Chongryon is a sensitive political issue directly related to the DPRK.
					
					 Japan should prudently handle the issue of Chongryon-related facilities as a political matter, bearing in mind that any action to destroy Chongryon precisely means the one against the DPRK.

articles.title: War Exercises Aim at Preemptive Attack on DPRK--Minju Joson
articles.content:
War Exercises Aim at Preemptive Attack on DPRK--Minju Joson
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises are the DPRK-targeted nuclear war maneuvers to preempt a surprise attack, says Minju Joson Thursday in a bylined commentary. It goes on:
					 A clear proof of this is the pretext under which they are underway. The U.S. and the south Korean authorities claim that the exercises are aimed to "remove nuclear weapons and weapons of mass destruction" of the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists assert that they can threaten or blackmail other countries and nations as they please with nuclear weapons and WMD but others can never be allowed to have access to means to defend themselves. This is their brigandish logic.
					
					 They talk about "defense" and "annual exercises" but they are sophism to cover the aggressive nature of the exercises and mislead the public opinion.
					
					 More serious is that those exercises have been kicked off right after the hard-won north-south dialogue came to a rupture.
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean warmongers are openly blustering that the war exercises are aimed to "occupy north".
					
					 This proves once again that the rhetoric about "peace" oft-repeated by them is aimed at invasion of the DPRK and they have no willingness to improve the north-south relations.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Accuses S. Korea of Bringing N-S Relations Catastrophe
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Accuses S. Korea of Bringing N-S Relations Catastrophe
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- The south Korean conservative forces' seizure of power was a start of the acts going against history as it brought the June 15 era of reunification back to the era of confrontation and escalated confrontation and tension between the north and the south, says Rodong Sinmun, a major newspaper of the DPRK, Thursday in a bylined article. 
					 The south Korean ruling conservative forces pushed to total bankruptcy the north-south relations which made a dynamic advance, causing them to go back to the era of distrust and confrontation more than 10 years ago, the article says, terming these acts unpardonable treachery and anti-reunification acts.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					  The south Korean authorities made desperate efforts to scrap the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, the guiding principle for improving the north-south relations, denying them. They stood against inter-Korean dialogue and cooperation and scuttled them.
					
					 The south Korean ruling forces have desperately sought military confrontation and a war of aggression against the DPRK, not detente between the north and the south.
					
					 The past three years in south Korea witnessed unceasing military provocations escalating tension and increasing the danger of war.
					
					 What merits the most serious attention is that the south Korean puppet warmongers fabricated the most hideous "Cheonan" case, an unprecedented anti-DPRK farce, in March last year to slander the DPRK and find an excuse for igniting a war against it. It was followed by the Yonphyong Island shelling incident, another dangerous military provocation against the DPRK, in November.
					
					 With these two incidents as a momentum, the south Korean warmongers went to the extremes in their moves to do harm to the DPRK and ignite a new war against it and the situation in Korea was so tense that a war might break out at any moment. Their true colors as warmongers found a vivid expression in their madcap war moves against the DPRK.
					
					 The north-south relations on which the destiny of the nation and the future of reunification hinge can never be reduced to a plaything of the south Korean ruling forces pursuing a policy of confrontation with the DPRK.
					
					 They are bound to be judged for having pushed the north-south relations to catastrophe.

articles.title: Championing Peace Called for--Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Championing Peace Called for--Rodong Sinmun 
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- The struggle to champion peace provides a sure guarantee for defending sovereignty of countries and nations and achieving development of the new century. Rodong Sinmun says this in a bylined article Thursday. 
					 The article goes on:
					
					 Peace and stability are seriously jeopardized in different parts of the world and independent development of countries is seriously deterred by the imperialists' high-handedness, policy for hegemony and moves for aggression and war.
					
					 Peace never comes by itself. It can be achieved through the struggle against the imperialists only. 
					
					 It is important matter in the struggle for defending peace to clearly understand the essence of the imperialists' cunning method of aggression and take the principled stand towards it. 
					
					 The world progressives desirous of peace should not allow the aggression and interference by the imperialists but strongly counter them. 
					
					 Bolstering a deterrent for self-defense is a sure guarantee for shattering the imperialists' war moves and championing peace. They do not dare provoke countries with powerful self-reliant defence capacity. 
					
					 Unity is a key to victory in the struggle for peace. 
					
					 Averting a war and maintaining peace on the Korean Peninsula is not a matter limited to this area. They are vital to preserving peace of the world. 
					
					 A war has not broken out in the peninsula, world's hot spot, because the people of the DPRK have steadily worked hard to avert a war and maintain peace in the peninsula under the banner of peace in the whole course of the revolution and construction.
					
					 The Korean people will continue to conduct dynamic struggle for shattering the war policy of the imperialist aggression forces under the banner of peace to firmly defend sovereignty of the country and socialism and actively promote the victorious advance of human cause of peace.

articles.title: Intention of S. Korean Authorities Keen on War Maneuvers Exposed
articles.content:
Intention of S. Korean Authorities Keen on War Maneuvers Exposed
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea issued a commentary on Feb. 28 disclosing the vicious intention of the puppet authorities hell-bent on the DPRK-targeted joint military exercises with the U.S.
					 The exercises, Key Resolve and Foal Eagle, are aimed to carry into practice OPLAN 5029, a scenario of the U.S. for a reckless war against the DPRK, the commentary said.
					
					 It charged that the present "government" is joining in these dangerous war moves for aggression on the DPRK in a bid to attain its political aims.
					
					 The authorities seek to coil up the tension through the saber-rattling so as to prolong the remaining days of the "government" on the brink of ruin, it pointed out.
					
					 It is none other than the U.S. and the present authorities that bring a war crisis to this land, the commentary said.
					
					 It warned that if the authorities ignite a war to maintain their power, disregarding the people's life and security, they will be doomed to destruction.

articles.title: S. Korean Military Accused of Its Psychological Warfare against DPRK
articles.content:
S. Korean Military Accused of Its Psychological Warfare against DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Hankuk Ilbo in its editorial on Feb. 28 chided the puppet military for its psychological warfare against the DPRK as it escalates the tension on the Korean Peninsula.
					 Recalling that the military authorities resumed this warfare six years after it was suspended in the areas along the military demarcation line under an agreement between the south and the north in 2004, the editorial noted that they are massively sending balloons carrying baskets full of garments, etc. into the areas of the north these days.
					
					 Drawing attention to the fact that the army is joining in the operation for scattering leaflets launched by non-governmental conservative bodies, the editorial urged the authorities to refrain from acts of provoking the north.

articles.title: Halt to Key Resolve and Foal Eagle Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Halt to Key Resolve and Foal Eagle Demanded in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- The U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises, Key Resolve and Foal Eagle, which pose a threat to peace on the Korean Peninsula, came under fire by a public organization of south Korea.
					 The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty, in a statement on Feb. 28, strongly condemned the south Korean and U.S. authorities for having launched the exercises despite the people's protest.
					
					 The start of the saber-rattling is creating a war atmosphere in this land, the statement said, urging the bellicose forces to stop at once the DPRK-targeted war games harassing peace.

articles.title: Ministry of Unification's Reckless Behavior Blasted in S. Korea
articles.content:
Ministry of Unification's Reckless Behavior Blasted in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- The Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers Corps in south Korea issued a statement on Feb. 28 to denounce the authorities for their reckless behavior.
					 The authorities prevented the joint declaration of women in the north and the south from being published to mark the 92nd anniversary of the March First Popular Uprising.
					
					 The statement charged that the Ministry of Unification refused the application for contact, submitted by the Council to announce the declaration carrying the will of the women in the south and the north, and disallowed even fax transmission.
					
					 We strongly protest against this anti-reunification behavior of the "government", it said.
					
					 The organization will lay bare the atrocities of the Japanese imperialists through north-south seminar of women for settlement of the "comfort women" issue, exhibition and other joint actions, the statement said, adding: It will also strive to the last to settle accounts with Japan over its past crimes in firm solidarity with all the women in the south and the north and overseas and those of conscience the world over.
					
					 Though the publication of the joint declaration came to failure owing to the "government's" obstruction, the Council made public a joint resolution in the name of 20 women's organizations of south Korea. Among them were the Women's Solidarity, the Women's Society for Achieving Peace and the Federation of Women's Organizations.
					
					 The resolution censured the Japanese government for distorting the history of aggression and war and seeking to revive militarism, far from reflecting on the unethical crimes such as plunder, massacres and rude violation of dignity and rights of many Korean women though nearly a century has passed since the March First Uprising.
					
					 It called upon the women to wage a stubborn struggle against Japan's distortion of history and revival of militarism and conduct more dynamic activities for peace and independent reunification under the banner of the June 15 joint declaration.

articles.title: S. Korean Newspaper Urges Government to Exercise Self-restraint
articles.content:
S. Korean Newspaper Urges Government to Exercise Self-restraint
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- The tension is again mounting on the Korean Peninsula as Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military maneuvers were kicked off on Feb. 28. The south Korean Hangyore said in an editorial titled "Who Is Escalating Tension on Korean Peninsula? Why?" on Tuesday.
					 South Korea should exercise restraint in its acts, the editorial urged, and went on:
					
					 The government is describing the military exercises as "annual drills of defensive nature" but sources confirm that they put a greater emphasis on coping with the "contingency in the north."
					
					 What matters is that south Korea is provoking the north by further intensifying its psychological warfare against it.
					
					 The army has so far scattered millions of leaflets critical of the system in the north since last year while distributing daily necessities since early in February.
					
					 Even some lawmakers from the "Grand National Party" took direct part in scattering leaflets.
					
					 Not content with this, some legislators from the party and conservative media are crying out for south Korea's nuclear development.
					
					 This debate itself leads to the escalation of the tension on the peninsula.
					
					 Lurking behind this is an ulterior design to insist on the theory of "the collapse of the north" to the last and seek the rally of the conservative forces irrespective of the situation on the peninsula.

articles.title: Solidarity Actions for Issue of Support to Korean Schools Staged in Japan
articles.content:
Solidarity Actions for Issue of Support to Korean Schools Staged in Japan
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- Solidarity actions of Koreans in Japan and Japanese citizens were staged to apply tuition-waiver program to the Korean schools in Japan.
					 Students of Aichi Korean Middle and High School, Koreans in Japan, members of the Aichi Network Demanding the Application of Tuition-waiver Program to Korean Schools and Japanese citizens conducted street information service in Nagoya City on Feb. 19.
					
					 A rally was held before the information service. Speakers said at the rally that they could not repress resentment at the unreasonable measure taken by the Japanese authorities to suspend the procedures for applying the tuition-waiver program to the Korean schools.
					
					 They declared that they would conduct various campaigns including the one urging the Japanese government and Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology to move for the settlement of the issue supporting the Korean schools.

articles.title: Meeting on Japan-DPRK Friendship Held in Tokyo
articles.content:
Meeting on Japan-DPRK Friendship Held in Tokyo 
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- A meeting on the Japan-DPRK friendship took place in Tokyo on Feb. 24.
					 Present there were personages and members of Juche idea study organizations of Japan and the Japan-Korea Cultural Interchange Association. Officials of the Choson Sinbo Company were present there on invitation.
					
					 Jyun Shimizu, deputy chief director of the Japan-Korea Cultural Interchange Association, cited facts to expose the aggression committed by the Japanese imperialists against Korea. Japan "developed" at the sacrifice of Korea, he noted.
					
					 History and culture are made by people, he said, underlining the need to clearly know about the past history of Japan and push forward the process to improve the relations with the DPRK.
					
					 He went on to say: The Korean Peninsula was divided as the aftermath of Japan's colonial rule. If the U.S. blocks its reunification, the diplomatic policy to be pursued by the Japanese government is to oppose it.

articles.title: US-S. Korea Military Drills under Fire
articles.content:
US-S. Korea Military Drills under Fire 
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- Organizations of the Czech Republic lashed out at the U.S. and the south Korean warlike forces' Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises. 
					 They are the Czech Group for the Study and Materialization of the Juche Idea and the Paektusan Czech-Korea Friendship Association.
					
					 In a joint statement on Feb. 27 they said:
					
					 The exercises for aggression on the part of the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet forces are a provocation to the DPRK working to defuse the tension of the Korean Peninsula in a peaceful way through wide-ranging dialogue. They are also a serious threat to peace and security in the region and the rest of the world.
					
					 We vehemently condemn the joint military exercises and urge the U.S. and the south Korean authorities to stop their moves for provoking a war of aggression at once.
					
					 We express full support for the Korean people in the efforts to reunify the country independently and peacefully.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birthday Marked
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birthday Marked
						
Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- The Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain on Feb. 15 posted on its Internet homepage "One Korea Network" special write-ups with photos on Songun feats of General Secretary Kim Jong Il on the occasion of his birthday.
					 The homepage in an article cited facts to show that media and Internet media of south Korea edited a large number of articles and photos on his revolutionary activities last year. 
					
					 It also informed that the progressive organizations of south Korea have posted on Internet everyday the facts about south Koreans' reverence for him.
					
					 It carried what the south Korean people have said about the facts that Kim Jong Il paid historic visit to China twice last year to put the DPRK-China relations on a new higher stage and open a fresh turning phase for peace and stability of the Korean Peninsula and the people in the DPRK are translating his intention and plan into brilliant reality, closely rallied around him.

articles.title: Chinese Paper Flails US-Japan-S. Korea Military Drills
articles.content:
Chinese Paper Flails US-Japan-S. Korea Military Drills
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- China's People's Daily on Feb. 28 denounced the joint military exercises of the U.S., Japan and south Korea.
					 In an article titled "Military exercises are aimed to keep pressure and tighten alliance" the newspaper said that the exercises were outwardly annual ones in the main, but the DPRK regarded them as a provocation now that the acute confrontation has lasted since March last year.
					
					 The policy toward the DPRK pursued by the U.S., Japan and south Korea will deepen instability of regional situation and thus surely increase the danger, it said, and went on:
					
					 The political meaning of modern military exercises has already surpassed the military meaning.
					
					 Judging from strategic view, one of the main links in the U.S. world strategy is to constantly intensify coordination and cooperation with south Korea and Japan through military exercises and maintain its military existence and position in Northeast Asia.
					
					 Therefore, the U.S., Japan and south Korea will seek to hold the upper hand in the forthcoming change of security structure in Northeast Asia.

articles.title: Iran Calls on IAEA to Act Independently
articles.content:
Iran Calls on IAEA to Act Independently
 Tehran, March 1 (KCNA) -- Iran's Foreign Minister Ali Akbar Salehi called on the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) to act independently on Feb. 27.
					 He branded as an "unfounded one" the IAEA's latest report on alleged studies to the effect that Iran has possibly worked on nuclear weapons.
					
					 He stressed that the IAEA should act independently and prevent taking side by the western states.

articles.title: Belarus Rejects West's False Allegations
articles.content:
Belarus Rejects West's False Allegations
Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- Belarusian Foreign Ministry in its statement on Feb. 28 rejected the West's allegations about Belarus.
					 The Western media have accused the Belarusian government of illegally supplying arms to Cote d'Ivoire, it said, calling it allegations against Belarus as "information war."
					
					 The statement pointed out that the destructive information attack is being carried out against Belarus, aimed at discrediting the country.

articles.title: Palestine's Stance against Jewish Settlements Reiterated
articles.content:
Palestine's Stance against Jewish Settlements Reiterated
						
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas said that there is international consensus against construction of Jewish settlements at a press conference on Feb. 28.
					 14 countries of the UNSC condemned the settlements and called for halting it, he said.
					
					 The international stance was totally in harmony with the Palestinian stance, he said. He called for halting all kinds of settlement in the Palestinian territory, ending the occupation and establishing the independent Palestinian state.

articles.title: Hispanic Groups in US Complain Obscene Spanish-Language Talk Show
articles.content:
Hispanic Groups in US Complain Obscene Spanish-Language Talk Show
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- All forms of discriminations are rampant in the United States, sparking public furor.
					 Two Hispanic-American organizations in California on Feb. 28 filed a joint complaint with the Federal Communications Commission.
					
					 The complaint was in response to a string of broadcasts of the Spanish-language television talk show against women, gay and lesbian minorities.

articles.title: Climate Change Causes Ecological Destruction in Western North America
articles.content:
Climate Change Causes Ecological Destruction in Western North America
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- Lodgepole pine that plays a key role in many western ecosystems in North America is already shrinking in range as a result of climate change and may almost disappear, according to a new study released on Feb. 28.
					 It said that the lodgepole pine is expected to be able to survive in only 17 percent of its current range in the western parts of North America by 2080.

articles.title: Yamakuchi: Natural Demise Starts from Ground Up
articles.content:
Yamakuchi: Natural Demise Starts from Ground Up
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- Yamakuchi, representative of the New Komeito Party of Japan, at a session of its central management board on Feb. 24 said that the present government is showing death symptoms.
					 "Natural demise started from the ground up", he said, commenting on the resignation tendered by Matsuki, parliamentary secretary at the Ministry of Agriculture, Forest and Fisheries from the Democratic Party of Japan.

articles.title: Anecdotes about Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Anecdotes about Kim Jong Suk 
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- One July day in Juche 28 (1939), anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk was assigned by President Kim Il Sung to a task for taking care of a sick guerrilla for a month, apart from her unit.
					 Though hard pressed for everything, she began the treatment with a high degree of responsibility.
					
					 She tied to a pillar of the ward mushrooms as many as the treatment days she promised to the President and took one away every day, doing her best for the treatment.
					
					 Thanks to her devoted effort, the patient recovered from illness the day when she took off the 29th mushroom.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige sobre terreno varios institutos
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige sobre terreno varios institutos
						
Pyongyang, 3 de marzo (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, dirigio sobre el terreno el Instituto de Ciencia de Verduras de Pyongyang y el Instituto de Plantas Decorativas de Pyongyang acondicionados modernamente.
					  El Dirigente estuvo primero en el Instituto de Ciencia de Verduras de Pyongyang, que cuenta con 500 mil metros cuadrados de solar y esta situado en las afueras de la ciudad de Pyongyang.
					
					El instituto tiene muchos invernaderos y parcelas de investigacion de amplia superficie, dotados de equipos de estudio y produccion de punta.
					
					  Esta base moderna y universal de ciencia de verduras maneja con computadoras todos los procesos de trabajo como el riego de aguas y abonamiento a las plantas y el control de temperatura y humedad.
					
					  El colectivo de estudio del instituto cultivo nuevamente mas de 50 variedades de 20 plantas como el pepino no.19 de uso de invernadero y el tomate no.15 de uso de invernadero y desarrollo mas de 20 tecnicas nuevas como la produccion de col en el invernadero de membrana sin calefaccion y elevo en mas de 2 veces la produccion en comparacion con la anterior.
					
					  El Dirigente recorrio durante largo tiempo varios lugares del instituto como los invernaderos solares de cultivo acuatico y de membrana y se cercioro en detalles el estado de estudio de ciencia y de produccion.
					
					  El Dirigente vio con mucha atencion las verduras producidas nuevamente por los cientificos y tecnicos del instituto como berenjena redonda y semi-redonda, nabo primaveral, pimienta dulce, etc. y valoro su abnegado espiritu de servicio al pueblo diciendo que es gran exito el que haya preparado la firme base cientifica y tecnica capaz de contribuir activamente en la vida alimentaria y el fomento de salud del pueblo y aumentara la produccion de verduras.
					
					  Senalo que el Instituto de Ciencia de Verduras de Pyongyang ocupa la posicion importante en aumentar la produccion de verduras del pais y mejorar la vida del pueblo y presento las tareas programaticas que incumben al instituto. 
					
					Acto seguido, el Dirigente dirigio en el terreno el Instituto de Plantas Decorativas de Pyongyang, cuyo terreno fue fijado en persona por el y dotado de todos los equipos necesarios a la investigacion.
					
					El instituto resulta ultramoderno contando con el invernadero moderno donde todos los procesos laborales, incluido el control de la temperatura y la humedad, se controlan automaticamente por los ordenadores.
					
					Luego de escuchar la explicacion ante el panorama, se entero detalladamente del estado de construccion e investigacion recorriendo la sala de investigacion de biotecnologia y otros lugares.
					
					Se reunio con el investigador Ri Ung Ho, Cientifico del Pueblo, profesor y doctor titular, y otros cientificos y tecnicos, quienes lograron incontables exitos dedicando largo tiempo al estudio de plantas decorativas, y evaluo altamente sus meritos.
					
					Destaco la necesidad de seguir invirtiendo ingentes esfuerzos en el cultivo de plantas decorativas para hacer florecer todas las flores en nuestra patria, tan hermosa y confortable para vivir, y presento las tareas programaticas que se presentan ante el instituto.
					
					En la ocasion le acompanaron Kim Jong Un, vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del PTC, Hong Sok Hyong, miembro del Buro Politico y secretario del CC del PTC, Kim Kyong Hui, miembro del BP y jefa de departamento del CC del PTC, Jang Song Thaek, miembro suplente del BP del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del CDN y Thae Jong Su, miembro suplente del BP y secretario del CC del PTC.

articles.title: MINREX organiza encuentro con miembros de embajada cubana
articles.content:
MINREX organiza encuentro con miembros de embajada cubana
Pyongyang, 3 de marzo (ATCC) -- El Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea organizo este jueves en el Club para el Cuerpo Diplomatico Taedonggang el encuentro de amistad con los miembros de la Embajada de la Republica Cuba en Corea con motivo del 25o aniversario de la visita a la RPDC del primer secretario del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de Cuba, Fidel Castro Ruz.
					Fueron invitados a la ocasion el embajador Jose Manuel Galego Montano y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica cubana.
					
					Estuvieron presentes el vicecanciller Kim Hyong Jun y otros funcionarios del MINREX.
					
					Los participantes departieron sobre el tema de desarrollar mas las relaciones bilaterales y realizaron juegos deportivos y de recreo.

articles.title: Sesionada reunion anual del Comite Coreano de Solidaridad con Cuba
articles.content:
Sesionada reunion anual del Comite Coreano de Solidaridad con Cub
Pyongyang, 3 de marzo (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar este jueves en el Club para el Cuerpo Diplomatico Taedonggang la reunion anual del Comite Coreano de Solidaridad con Cuba.
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes Kim Yong Jin, presidente del Comite de Educacion y del CCSC, Mun Jae Chol, vicepresidente del Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero, y los miembros del CCSC.
					
					Tambien se distinguian el embajador Jose Manuel Galego Montano y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica cubana en Corea.
					
					En la ocasion hubo balance de los trabajos realizados en el ano pasado por el CCSC para estrechar la amistad y solidaridad con el pueblo cubano, que bajo la direccion del Partido Comunista de Cuba, avanza con la bandera del socialismo defendiendo la soberania del pais y las conquistas de la revolucion, y se debatio el plan de trabajo del ano en curso.

articles.title: Tiene lugar la reunion nacional de activistas de UTAC
articles.content:
Tiene lugar la reunion nacional de activistas de UTAC
Pyongyang, 3 de marzo (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 3 en esta capital la Reunion Nacional de Activistas de la Union de Trabajadores Agricolas de Corea de la Epoca del Songun.
					  En la ocasion estuvieron presentes Choe Yong Rim, primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros, Choe Ryong Hae, secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Ri Kyong Sik, ministro de Agricultura, y otros funcionarios.
					
					  La reunion hizo balance de los exitos y experiencias logrados en el pasado en la labor de la UTAC y debatio las tareas y remedios de los trabajadores agricolas y los miembros de esa union para cumplir su mision en la materializacion de la orientacion del PTC sobre la revolucion agricola.
					
					Presento el informe el presidente del Comite Central de la UTAC, Ri Myong Gil, e intervinieron otros.
					
					  Los oradores se refirieron a que bajo la energica guia del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, se abrio la nueva historia de ordenamiento de la tierra de gran dimension y de construccion de canales de riego por gravedad y se sento la base firme para el desarrollo de agricultura nacional, incluyendo la produccion del abono Juche y la roturacion de marismas Taegyedo.
					
					  Subrayaron que las organizaciones de la UTAC deben cumplir su mision y deber como entidad de educacion ideologica en la lucha por alcanzar la meta de produccion de cereales de este ano.
					
					  Dijeron que las granjas ejemplares tienen que avanzar a pasos mas firmes proponiendo metas mas altas de emulacion y todas las granjas del pais han de esforzarse sustancialmente por alcanzar el nivel de las primeras.
					
					  En la reunion fue aprobado el llamamiento a los miembros de la UTAC y trabajadores agricolas de todo el pais.

articles.title: Orquesta del Siglo 21 ofrece su primera funcion en Pyongyang
articles.content:
Orquesta del Siglo 21 ofrece su primera funcion en Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 3 de marzo (ATCC) -- La Orquesta del Siglo 21 de Rusia, de visita en Corea, ofrecio el dia 3 su primera funcion en el Gran Teatro de Pyongyang Este.
					  Actuaron en la ocasion los famosos directores, ejecutantes y cantantes, incluyendo los actores del pueblo y benemeritos.
					
					  Se presentaron diversas piezas, tales como, el coro y musica orquestal "Cancion de marcha por la paz y el amor", el solo femenino "Muguete", el duo mixto "Ire contigo", el solo masculino "Si usted no existe" y las canciones coreanas: el solo masculino "Luz primaveral de amor", el cuarteto mixto "Brindemos", etc.
					
					  Los ejecutantes demostraron con su gran habilidad artistica el ardiente patriotismo, las costumbres tradicionales y la vida romantica del pueblo ruso.
					
					  Disfrutaron la funcion el ministro de Cultura An Tong Chun y otros funcionarios, creadores y artistas del Conjunto Artistico Mansudae y otras entidades artisticas centrales, profesores y estudiantes del sector de ensenanza del arte.
					
					  Estuvieron presentes tambien el embajador Valery Sukhinin y otros miembros de la embajada rusa en Corea.

articles.title: Asociacion de Amistad con Corea publica edicion especial de Internet
articles.content:
Asociacion de Amistad con Corea publica edicion especial de Internet
Pyongyang, 3 de marzo (ATCC) -- Con motivo del dia de nacimiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, la Asociacion de Amistad con Corea con sede en Espana hizo el 15 de febrero una edicion especial en la pagina web "Network de una Corea" publicando las fotos alusivas a las proezas acumuladas por el en su guia sobre la revolucion mediante el Songun.
					La pagina web presento con datos detallados que en el ano pasado, los periodicos, agencias noticieras, radios y medios de prensa via Internet del Sur de Corea se hicieron ecos de los articulos y fotos sobre las actividades revolucionarias del Dirigente.
					
					Prosiguio que las entidades progresistas surcoreanas publican todos los dias en Internet los articulos de elogio al Dirigente.
					
					Transmitio las opiniones de los habitantes surcoreanos que encomian al Dirigente por haber colocado en la etapa mas alta las relaciones Corea-China mediante sus dos visitas historicas a China realizadas el ano pasado y abierto una nueva coyuntura de viraje para la paz y estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana y al pueblo coreano que unido firmemente en torno al Dirigente, materializa satisfactoriamente el proposito y proyectos de este.
